node.title: NSO Group: Israel launches inquiry into police hacking claims
node.description: Israel's government will set up a commission of inquiry to examine allegations that the police used spyware to hack the phones of Israeli public figures without authorisation.

node.title: Tonga: How an internet blackout left many desperate for money
node.description: The telecommunications breakdown caused by Tonga's volcanic eruption and tsunami cut off a vital source of funds to Tongans at a time when they needed it most.

node.title: How U.S. tax law widens racial wealth gap
node.description: Law professor Dorothy A. Brown claims the U.S. tax system impoverishes Black Americans. Here's how.

node.title: 'We were really lucky': Schools escape major damage after rain floods grounds
node.description: Two Taranaki schools managed to escape rising floodwaters damaging classrooms after heavy rainfall over the long weekend. Audio

node.title: The deep unfairness of New Zealand public holidays
node.description: If you work weekdays you're probably enjoying a day off today - and if you are working, you're likely getting time and a half. But a surprisingly large section of our workforce doesn't get eitherâ€¦

node.title: National Archives transferred 15 boxes of Trump records from Mar-a-Lago
node.description: Among the documents now properly in the Archives' possession are letters between Trump and North Korean Leader Kim Jong Un.

node.title: White House task force releases labor union report
node.description: A new report includes nearly 70 recommendations to "promote worker organizing and collective bargaining for federal employees."
